Similarity package¶

Submodules¶

Similarity.distances module¶

Similarity.distances.ccor(ts1, ts2)[source]¶

given two standardized time series, compute their cross-correlation using FFT

Similarity.distances.distance(ts1, ts2, mult=1)[source]¶

Calculates the distance metric using the kernal coefficient

Similarity.distances.kernel_corr(ts1, ts2, mult=1)[source]¶

compute a kernelized correlation so that we can get a real distance

Similarity.distances.max_corr_at_phase(ts1, ts2)[source]¶
Similarity.distances.random_ts(a)[source]¶

Creates a TimeSeries with random values a: scaling term to generate random values for time series

Similarity.distances.stand(x, m, s)[source]¶

standardize timeseries x by mean m and std deviation s

Similarity.distances.tsmaker(m, s, j)[source]¶

Makes a TimeSeries whose values are approximately normally distributed m: location parameter for normal pdf s: scale parameter for normal pdf j: coefficient for extra randomness added to normally distributed values

Similarity.find_most_similar module¶

Similarity.find_most_similar.find_most_similiar(filename, n, vantage_pts, sm)[source]¶

Finds n most similiar time series to the time series of interest (filename) by using the supplied vantage points

filename: timeseries of interest n: number of similiar timeseries to return (n must be between 1 and 20) vantage_pts: a list of the vantage point numbers

Returns: list of n most similiar filenames

Notes: Correct behavior is not gaurenteed when n > the number of vantage points

Similarity.find_most_similar.find_similarity_of_points_in_radius(closest_vantage_pt, ts1, radius, sm)[source]¶

Given a vantage point and a radius, find the points that fall within the circle around the vantage point. Then calculates the distance from all of these points to the timeseries of interest.

closest_vantage_pt: number of the vantage point being considered ts1: timeseries of interest radius: radius of circle to consider

Returns: list of tuples (distance, timeseries id) in sorted order

Similarity.find_most_similar.sanity_check(filename, n, sm)[source]¶

Function that manually finds the n most similiar timeseries to the given timeseries. Serves as a check of the vantage point method

Returns: list of n most similiar filenames

Similarity.generate_time_series module¶

Similarity.generate_time_series.generate_time_series()[source]¶

Similarity.pick_vantage_points module¶

Similarity.pick_vantage_points.pick_vantage_points(arg, sm)[source]¶

Code which picks 20 vantage points and produces a database for each one. The database stores (key,value) pairs where: key = distance from timeseries to vantage point (kernel coefficient) value = id of timeseries (0-999)

returns: list of vantage points (integers from 0-999)

Module contents¶

Similarity.generate_time_series()[source]¶
Similarity.pick_vantage_points(arg, sm)[source]¶

Code which picks 20 vantage points and produces a database for each one. The database stores (key,value) pairs where: key = distance from timeseries to vantage point (kernel coefficient) value = id of timeseries (0-999)

returns: list of vantage points (integers from 0-999)
